item.title: Organizing Papers
item.description: As a graduate student, you read a lot of journal articles… a lot. With the material in the articles being as difficult as it is, I didn’t want to worry about organizing everything as well. That’s why I wrote this script to help (I may have also been procrastinating from studying for my qualifiers). This was one of my earliest little projects, so I’m not claiming that this is the best way to do anything.

item.title: Tidy Data in Action
item.description: Hadley Whickham wrote a famous paper (for a certain definition of famous) about the importance of tidy data when doing data analysis. I want to talk a bit about that, using an example from a StackOverflow post, with a solution using pandas. The principles of tidy data aren’t language specific. A tidy dataset must satisfy three criteria (page 4 in Whickham’s paper): Each variable forms a column. Each observation forms a row.
